intro: Discocalyx angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf discocalyx, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
